New Records: Denmark have drawn all three of their group games for the first time ever at a major tournament (World Cup & Euros)
Denmark (28y 148d) named their oldest starting XI for a UEFA European Championship game since 2004
Against Serbia, Eriksen added another two chances created to his total haul of 13 at EURO 2024, the most ever by a Danish player at a major tournament on record (World Cup & Euros since 1980)
Denmark have qualified for the knockout stages of a UEFA European Championship on three of their last four attempts
Key Match Events: Denmark’s solitary shot equated to just 0.06 expected goals (xG) and ensured they accumulated only two first-half shots on target across their three Group C matches, the joint fewest of any side in the tournament
Serbia's solitary shot equated to just 0.06 expected goals (xG) and ensured they accumulated only two first-half shots on target across their three Group C matches
Alexander Bah headed a good chance off target – that was the longest wait for the first shot in a Euro 2024 match so far
Serbia went into the game in Munich with more than a fighting chance of progress, knowing a victory could even see them top the group

Serbia turned to Dusan Tadic in an attempt to try something different. For a split early in the second half, it looked as though he’d provided the answer, slicing open the Denmark defence to feed fellow half-time substitute Luka Jovic
Pre-Game Insights: We always want to win, we miss being in the locker room singing about how we won, that’s what we want,” Denmark coach Kasper Hjulmand said pre-game after successive draws in their first two games
Post-Match Reflections: With their own underwhelming output in front of goal, it’s fair to say that defensive solidity ultimately played a major role in Denmark’s progress to the last 16, where hosts Germany await
Miscellaneous Highlights: Serbia mustered just one shot on target against Denmark, with their total haul of six shots on target at Euro 2024 their lowest-ever figure as an independent nation at a major tournament (World Cup & Euros since 2006)
Denmark ended the group stage with the third-lowest xG against (2.3) among the teams to have played three matches
Serbia are now without a victory in their last eight major tournament matches (Euros/World Cup – D3 L5), since a 1-0 win over Costa Rica at the 2018 World Cup
Others: Kasper Schmeichel was mostly a bystander even when his team were under pressure
Andersen and Jannik Vestergaard were key to that; the former won nine of 14 aerial duels, the latter five of eight, while they amassed nine clearances between them
A disappointingly tame Sergej Milinkovic-Savic effort from the edge of the box late on was as close as Serbia came to hoisting themselves into the knockouts
